Cyber terrorism: Any act that disrupts critical infrastructure or causes damage to computer systems.
Point 8 refers to the cyber crime of cyber terrorism, which is a serious offense under Indian law. Cyber terrorism refers to the use of internet technology to carry out terrorist activities that aim to cause harm to individuals or governments, disrupt essential services or spread fear among the public.
Under Indian law, cyber terrorism is defined and criminalized under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967, and the Indian IT Act, 2000. Section 66F of the IT Act provides for punishment for cyber terrorism, which includes acts committed with the intent to threaten the unity, integrity, sovereignty, or security of India, or to strike terror in the people or any section of the people. The punishment for cyber terrorism can range from imprisonment for life to a term of 10 years, along with a fine.
